intro: Monanthotaxis whytei, commonly known as the Cape York hakea, is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers arranged in spike-like clusters, typically blooming in winter. It is adapted to grow in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
